stanza.line: Where art thou Muse that thou forget'st so (a)long(/a)
To speak of that which gives thee all thy (b)might(/b)
Spend'st thou thy fury on some worthless (a)song(/a)
Darkening thy power to lend base subjects (b)light(/b)
In gentle numbers time so idly (d)spent(/d)
Sing to the ear that doth thy lays (c)esteem(/c)
And gives thy pen both skill and (d)argument(/d)
Rise resty Muse my love's sweet face (e)survey(/e)
If time have any wrinkle graven (f)there(/f)
If any be a satire to (e)decay(/e)
Give my love fame faster than Time wastes (g)life(/g)
So thou prevent'st his scythe and crooked (g)knife(/g)
